Question: Does the supplier have fewer than 10 employees?
Logic:
IF yes, RAISE 10
IF no, no change;
Notes: This question targets the stability of the supplier. Using the threshold 10 because of this source: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4424689/

Question: How long has this supplier been in business?
Type of answer: Range: less than 3 years, less than 5 years, less than 10 years, over 10 years
Answers: value=10;label="< 3 years" | value=5;label="3 - 5 years" | value=2;label="5 - 10 years" | value=10;label="I don't know"
Logic:
IF < 3, RAISE 10
IF 3-5, RAISE 5
IF 5-10, RAISE 2
IF > 10, no change;
Notes:
Configurable: year ranges

JG will find a basis for these years as we have done for Supplier Question 1.2

Question: How much of the supplier's total business is provided by the acquirer?
Type of answer:
Scale: 1-5 where 5 is "90%+ and 1 is "under 5%" 

Include option "I don't know"
Answers: value=10;label="< 25%" | value=5;label="25 - 50%" | value=0;label="50 - 100%" | value=10;label="I don't know"
Notes:
Configurable: Ranges and threshold 

Primarily a factor of control, not stability.

Question: Does supplier have access to the acquirer's portal for payment?
Type of answer: Checkboxes: 1) Portal for Payment, 2) Inventory information, 3) Networks and/or systems, 4) Physical facilities
Logic:
IF Portal for payment, RAISE 2
IF Inventory, RAISE 4
IF Networks and/or systems, RAISE 9
IF Physical, RAISE 10;

Type of answer: Checkboxes: 1) Portal for Payment, 2) Inventory information, 3) Networks and/or systems, 4) Physical facilities
Logic:
IF Portal for payment, RAISE 2
IF Inventory, RAISE 4
IF Networks and/or systems, RAISE 9
IF Physical, RAISE 10;

Question: Does supplier have access to acquirer-sensitive information (e.g., intellectual property, financial data, internal processes, etc.)?
Logic:
IF yes, RAISE 10
IF no, no change;

Question: Does the supplier have access to the acquirer's regulated data (e.g., PII, PHI, PCI, etc.)?
Logic:
IF yes, RAISE 10
IF no, no change;
Notes: Include in NIST IR that they may want to customize if they want to separate these questions

Question: Does this supplier follow relevant industry standards?
Type of answer: Dropdown: N/A, No, self-attestation, self-attestation with proof, self-attestation with third party assessment, conformity assessment
Answers: value=10;label="no" | value=7;label="self-attestation" | value=5;label="self-attestation with proof" | value=3;label="self-attestation with third-party assessment" | value=0;label="conformity assessment" | value=10;label="I don't know"
Logic:
IF no, RAISE 10
IF self-attestation, RAISE 7
IF self-attestation with proof, RAISE 5
IF self attestation with third party assessment, RAISE 3
IF conformity assessment, no change
IF N/A, no change

Question: Does this supplier operate in highly regulated industries or provides products/services to highly regulated industries (e.g., Financial services, Energy)?
Logic:
IF yes, no change
IF no, 10;

Question: Is the supplier owned, controlled, or influenced in full or in part by an entity of concern (e.g. foreign nation state, competitors)?
Type of answer:
Scale: 1-5 where 1 is "great concern" and 5 is "no concern at all"

Include option "I don't know"
Answers: value=10;label="1 (great concern)" | value=7;label="2" |  value=5;label="3" | value=3;label="4" | value=0;label="5 (no concern)" | value=10;label="I don't know"
Logic:
IF 1 (great concern), RAISE 10
IF 2, RAISE 7
IF 3, RAISE 5
IF 4, RAISE 3
IF 5 (no concern), no change;
Notes: Dave's Bubble: more detail for potential entities, as well as descriptions of ownership, control, and influence

Question: How sensitive is the supplier's ability to provide quality products/services to supply chain disruptions, both manmade and natural?
Type of answer:
Scale: 1-5 where 1 is "Very sensitive" and 5 is "Very robust"

Include option "I don't know"
Answers: value=10;label="1 (very sensitive)" | value=7;label="2" |  value=5;label="3" | value=3;label="4" | value=0;label="5 (very robust)" | value=10;label="I don't know"
Logic:
IF 1 (very sensitive), RAISE 10
IF 2, RAISE 7
IF 3, RAISE 5
IF 4, RAISE 3
IF 5 (very robust), no change;

Question: Has this supplier filled out a questionnaire to qualify for providing products or services to the acquirer?
Logic:
IF yes, no change
IF no, RAISE 10;

Question: Has the acquirer verified the information provided by the supplier on their supplier questionnaire?
Type of answer: Not verified (self-attestation), documentation review (self-attestation with proof), third party assessment, acquirer audit
Answers: value=10;label="not provided" | value=9;label="not verified" |  value=5;label="doc review" | value=3;label="third-party audit" | value=0;label="acquirer audit" | value=10;label="I don't know"
Logic:
IF not provided, RAISE 10
IF not verified, RAISE 9
IF doc review, RAISE 5
IF third party audit, RAISE 3
IF acquirer audit, no change;

Question: Is the acquirer able to influence this supplier's security practices through supplier agreements?
Type of answer: Scale: 1-5 where 1 is "not at all" and 5 is "yes, for all products and services"
Answers: value=10;label="1 (not at all)" | value=7;label="2" |  value=5;label="3" | value=3;label="4" | value=0;label="5 (yes, for all product)" | value=10;label="I don't know"
Logic:
IF 1 (not at all), RAISE 10
IF 2, RAISE 7
IF 3, RAISE 5
IF 4, RAISE 3
IF 5 (yes, for all product), no change;

Question: Does the acquirer know this supplier's sub-suppliers?
Answers: value=5;label="No existing relationships" | value=10;label="No" | value=5;label="Some" | value=0;label="All" | value=10;label="I don't know"
Logic:
IF yes, offer sub-supplier list import. RAISE 5 if there are no existing relationships. 
IF no, RAISE 10


Go to next section

IF Some, RAISE 5
IF All, no change;
Notes: Yes/No - "No" invokes risk, "yes" invokes sub-supplier import. Tool should dynamically check whether relationships exist. If there is a relationship, positively impact risk score. Import not required for risk score benefit. No form available to fill out in v1.

Question: Has the supplier provided the acquirer with mitigation assurances (e.g. insurance, fallback partnerships with other vendors, etc)?
Logic:
IF yes, no change
IF no, RAISE 10;
